text: My wife has just been told she can book a covid vaccine :tada: !

elements.text: My wife has just been told she can book a covid vaccine

text: Such great news!

elements.text: Such great news!

text: I think I can also, just saw news here :sweat_smile:

elements.text: I think I can also, just saw news here

text: Awesome! Is this for the first shot Oxford vaccine?

elements.text: Awesome! Is this for the first shot Oxford vaccine?

text: Moderna or Pfizer, those are the only two approved in the US so far

elements.text: Moderna or Pfizer, those are the only two approved in the US so far

text: <@U6A936746> which one for your wife?

elements.text: which one for your wife?

text: Your in London currently?

elements.text: Your in London currently?

text: He's in Cambridge, I *think* we only have the Oxford/AstraZeneca vaccine in use currently, but I'm (rightly) last in line so not following this closely

elements.text: He's in Cambridge, I
think
we only have the Oxford/AstraZeneca vaccine in use currently, but I'm (rightly) last in line so not following this closely

text:
They haven't said.
But any vaccine is good.
They all have strong results saying that noone dies.
I think they were using Pfizer at the hospital a few weeks back. But I could be wrong
They might be using Oxford now.
I suspect they are using both.
Pfizer at the hospital, and Oxford everywhere else that doesn't have extreme freezers.
Since my wife is booked in to a local medical center and not the main hospital my guess thus is Oxford.

elements.text:
They haven't said.
But any vaccine is good.
They all have strong results saying that noone dies.
I think they were using Pfizer at the hospital a few weeks back. But I could be wrong
They might be using Oxford now.
I suspect they are using both.
Pfizer at the hospital, and Oxford everywhere else that doesn't have extreme freezers.
Since my wife is booked in to a local medical center and not the main hospital my guess thus is Oxford.

text: Is there an indication on when she might get the second shot?

elements.text: Is there an indication on when she might get the second shot?

text: No. Maybe they will say when she goes in for her appointment (next Friday)

elements.text: No. Maybe they will say when she goes in for her appointment (next Friday)

text:
Presumably 3 months later.
You can see on the stats that there is an up tick on 2nd dose the last few days.
I think that is people who got theirs in mid-December but late enough that their 2nd dose booking was cancelled and rescheduled to follow the new 12 week rule

elements.text:
Presumably 3 months later.
You can see on the stats that there is an up tick on 2nd dose the last few days.
I think that is people who got theirs in mid-December but late enough that their 2nd dose booking was cancelled and rescheduled to follow the new 12 week rule

text: <@U6A936746> even after one dose, you can probably let go of a lot of the tension I know you've been holding onto for the last year.

elements.text: even after one dose, you can probably let go of a lot of the tension I know you've been holding onto for the last year.

text: <@UB7JS9CHF> were you able to sign up? My parents in law (also MA) tried to get in right at 8, but it crashed

elements.text: were you able to sign up? My parents in law (also MA) tried to get in right at 8, but it crashed

text: Still trying!

elements.text: Still trying!

text: my flatmates got the vaccine earlier this week, with second dose currently scheduled for May

elements.text: my flatmates got the vaccine earlier this week, with second dose currently scheduled for May

text: I finally got an appointment, a couple hours drive away in Worcester, for the Pfizer vaccine, on Wednesday!

elements.text: I finally got an appointment, a couple hours drive away in Worcester, for the Pfizer vaccine, on Wednesday!

text: So, by around April 1st, I should at least be fairly well protected against dying from COVID-19 :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: So, by around April 1st, I should at least be fairly well protected against dying from COVID-19

text: (not necessarily from getting rather sick though, from what I’ve heard, especially from the SA variant)

elements.text: (not necessarily from getting rather sick though, from what I’ve heard, especially from the SA variant)

text:
<@UB7JS9CHF> you'll be much safer from everything (well, everything coronavirus twisted) 2 weeks from Wednesday. Not out of the woods entirely, but there's still quite a bit of protection from a single dose.

Think of it this way - there's some distribution of possible outcomes, and your distribution is about to shift dramatically towards the less-severe

elements.text:
you'll be much safer from everything (well, everything coronavirus twisted) 2 weeks from Wednesday. Not out of the woods entirely, but there's still quite a bit of protection from a single dose.

Think of it this way - there's some distribution of possible outcomes, and your distribution is about to shift dramatically towards the less-severe

text:
Yes, true, but I still plan on continuing to act as I have for the past 11 months, until my kids have been vaccinated also. :mask::mask::mask:
Mostly, I’ll be able to sleep better at night!

elements.text: Yes, true, but I still plan on continuing to act as I have for the past 11 months, until my kids have been vaccinated also.
Mostly, I’ll be able to sleep better at night!

text: That's the right call - definitely good to keep doing what you're doing. But you can hopefully relax a little

elements.text: That's the right call - definitely good to keep doing what you're doing. But you can hopefully relax a little

text: It was Pfizer

root.text: My wife has just been told she can book a covid vaccine :tada: !

elements.text: My wife has just been told she can book a covid vaccine
It was Pfizer
